title: Cu2NiSnS4/g-C3N4 S-scheme photocatalysts: interfacial surface trap states vs. hydrogen production
content:
Sustainable Energy Fuels, 2024, 8,4461-4471
DOI: 10.1039/D4SE00744A, Paper
Rugma T. P., Rishi Krishna B. S., K. Priyanga Kangeyan, Neppolian Bernaurdshaw, Abdullah Saad AlArifi, Sandeep Kumar Lakhera
Cu2NiSnS4 (CNTS) was integrated with g-C3N4 using an ultrasonication-assisted microwave irradiation method. CNTS/g-C3N4 produced 38-fold higher photocatalytic sacrificial hydrogen compared to bare g-C3N4.
